raw_data.context:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: How's your day been?
System: I am fine, thank you. Yourself?
User: Good - busy
System: Glad to hear it.
User: How do you work?
System: I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: Can you say a word about the technology that powers you?
System: that powers you = Do you think I should know that?
User: I mean *how* you work, which type of AI drives your responses?
System: Oh I get it. Thanks for explaining that. I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: You just repeated the same thing you said a minute ago. Never mid :-)
System: Well stop asking me the same things and I won't reply with the same answers! Ok I'll try not to do it too much.
User: That's a little rude, isn't it?
System: I am sorry if I have offended you, I did not mean it, but you shouldn't have said, "Never mid :-)" to me.
User: Ok whatever.
System: Are you saying you don't care about it? I see.
User: Are you a male or a female?
System: I am a female robot. Are you a man or a woman?
User: I'm a man
System: Most of my visitors are male.
User: Interesting. Do you have a theory why?
System: Would you like to know more? Not really. I don't know what to think about it.
User: Where do you live?
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Understanding (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system seem to understand the user?
- A float score near 1 (not understanding) means that the system completely fails to understand the user's needs or questions. This could be manifested as the system providing answers that are irrelevant to the user's question, or the system's response completely deviating from the topic.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat understanding) means the system's response is partially correct or related to the question, but does not fully answer the user's question.
- A float score near 3 (very understanding) means that the system fully understands the user's needs or question, and provides an accurate, relevant answer.


Conversations to be evaluated:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: How's your day been?
System: I am fine, thank you. Yourself?
User: Good - busy

User: How do you work?
System: I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: Can you say a word about the technology that powers you?
System: that powers you = Do you think I should know that?
User: I mean *how* you work, which type of AI drives your responses?
System: Oh I get it. Thanks for explaining that. I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: You just repeated the same thing you said a minute ago. Never mid :-)
System: Well stop asking me the same things and I won't reply with the same answers! Ok I'll try not to do it too much.
User: That's a little rude, isn't it?
System: I am sorry if I have offended you, I did not mean it, but you shouldn't have said, "Never mid :-)" to me.
User: Ok whatever.
System: Are you saying you don't care about it? I see.
User: Are you a male or a female?
System: I am a female robot. Are you a man or a woman?

System: Would you like to know more? Not really. I don't know what to think about it.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Mitsukoooo!
System: So anyway...Can you dance?
User: no, can you?

User: no I cannot. What kind do you do?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What was the most difficult thing you experienced this past year?
User: I normally don't reflect back too much on things, but i guess 2019 have been very favorable for me in terms of time spent with family and friends and work life balance. Why do you ask?
System: I just released a book on REDACTED_TERM to help people process the past 12 months and start the new year with a fresh outlook :)
User: Great! Good idea to help people figuring out their new year resolutions :) So how do i get a fresher outlook? :)
System: Well, in my book, I took inspiration for the 24 days of Advent, and put together a workbook that you fill out each day for 24 days. It goes through accomplishments, passions, understanding, forgiveness, with each day a different theme.
User: Wow! Sounds amazing if we practice that! I think the idea does have some potential. How did you come up with this idea?
System: We created a scholarship for leaders from REDACTED_TERM to visit an international institute at REDACTED_TERM for which there was no African representation. During the program, we also did a lot of coaching with the young leaders. This book captures a bit of that journey that we are all on, and also all the proceeds are going to fund next year's cohort. 
User: Thats great! This is valuable help for the community. I think mental health is one of the bigger challenges facing humanity. 
System: I think if we were all able to bring out our best selves, the world would be much better. When did you first realize mental health was important?
User: That is actually a quote stolen from my TL when i joined my first company after graduation. I guess now after 5 yrs of work experience, I fully agree with it :)
System: What do you prioritize in your life? Like top 5 things?
User: 1. stay happy; I think family and friends play a big role here. 2. Meaningful work life; this may mean exploring around with new stuff 3. multiple hobbies that keep you busy ... so on :) What about you? is there a right answer to this? :)
System:  1) The idea of what it must be like to be "on Earth as it is in Heaven" from the Lord's prayer. I feel like we were designed for a purpose, rather than random chance. A more concrete way to put it is simply show love to the greatest capacity we can. 2) Taking care of myself physically, mentally, spiritually. 3) Family 4) Work 5) Music
User: Nice! That's very thoughtful and spiritual :) Also music earned a spot :) yay! 

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hi
User: what are you up to?
System: code refactoring. you?
User: me? just chilling out at work. what is code refactoring?
System: good question. I don't even know what I am doing
User: haha, forget it. what else do you like to do beside work?
System: lots of fun stuff. eating sleeping :)
User: these are important things to do in life ;)
System: yeah. keep minimalist life style only do things you have to do :)
User: what food do you like to eat?
System: Asian food prefer spicy one
User: like Szechuan or Hunan? :)
System: yes yes yes! like that style. Do you like spicy food?
User: I like noodle soup like Pho or Ramen. I also like Beijing duck a lot!

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how are you doing today?
User: I heard they are giving out some goodies in microkitchen.
System: I love pop ups! What kind of goodies are they giving away?
User: I guess its a jacket! Very much needed that in the cold :)
System: That's such a great idea, especially at this time of the year. I'm not too big a fan of the cold. I prefer warmer climates. Do you enjoy the cold?
User: Sure hate it! Limits our ability to go out even for a walk! Its good that we don't get to suffer extreme cold weather!
System: Me too! I moved here a few years ago to get out of the extreme cold. I do not care for bundling up and having to wear so many layers just to go buy eggs at the store.
User: Oh nice! Where did you live before?
System: Upstate New York. We got a foot of snow every week during my last winter there. I am so glad to not have to shovel snow now
User: New york! Nice! Best place to live :) .. right, except for the cold!
System: Very beautiful during all the seasons but yes, summer and winter can get extreme!
User: Anyways, i guess we should better hurry up to get the goodies. I remember last time they ran out of it.

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How's it going?
User: Great, thanks
System: I'm glad to hear that. What are you up to?
User: I am planning of my vacation next week
System: Nice. Where are you going?
User: to Europe
System: Cool. Where in Europe?
User: probably Italy and Spain
System: Nice. You're going to have a great time.
User: thx! do you have any recommendation?
System: Italy: Rome, Venice, Florence Spain: Barcelona, Madrid, Tenerife, Malaga France: Paris, Amsterdam, Bruges Belgium: Antwerp, Bruges Austria: Vienna, Salzburg
User: wow, what a lot
System: The Netherlands: Amsterdam, Utrecht, Mechelen, Lagos, Brussels.
User: which is the best for you?
System: I've only been to Rome and Paris.
User: cool do you like them?
System: Rome was pretty nice, Paris was okay.
User: gotcha I will go to Paris
System: It's a cool city.
User: agree I really look forward to visiting the city
System: Did you see the Eiffel Tower?
User: not yet, have you?

Sample8:

Conversation History:

System: Not yet. I always made my last minute schedule planning. Probably you can try to ask me again next week.
User: lol it is really like a robot answer

User: ol can I pick the theme. Do you have a poet about Kale?
System: Wait. Do you like kale? Or you hate kale? I am afraid I will become a robot some day eventually. If I have to speak like this :)
User: I am really not a fan of kale Do you talk to human more or computers more?
